results.detail: FEMA and CDC guidance typically recommends 1 gallon (3.78 liters) per person per day for drinking and sanitation. WHO Sphere humanitarian standards specify 2.5-3 liters minimum for drinking and basic cooking, with 7.5-15 liters as adequate for all needs. The 4 liters figure is within reasonable range but most U.S. emergency preparedness sources cite 1 gallon (3.78L), making the claim directionally correct but not precisely matched to the most common standards.
